summary: This bill, the "Lower Drug Costs for Families Act," amends Title XVIII and 1860D-14B of the Social Security Act to expand prescription drug inflation rebates to the commercial market. It changes the base year for rebate calculations and specifies how to determine the total number of billing units for Part B and D drugs, including exclusions. The amendments related to Part B drugs would be effective January 1, 2026, while those for Part D drugs would take effect on October 1, 2025.
